Question: get a custom attribute of custom textview from XML: :How to get custom fontname Attributes of Custom TextView for Set font to Textview.Based on Attributes value set Font in TextViewpublic class MyTextView extends TextView{    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyle)    {        super(context, attrs, defStyle);        init();    }    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)    {        super(context, attrs);        init();    }    public MyTextView(Context context)    {        super(context);        init();    }    public void init()    {          // set font_name based on attribute value of textview in xml file          String font_name = "";        if (!isInEditMode())        {            Typeface tf = Typeface.createFromAsset(getContext().getAssets(),                    "fonts/"+font_name);            setTypeface(tf);        }    }In Xml File<com.Example.MyTextView             android:id="@+id/header"            android:layout_width="wrap_content"            android:layout_height="wrap_content"            fontname="font.ttf"            android:text="Header"   />I also Put font.ttf file in assets->fontsThank You

Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: get a custom attribute of custom textview from XML: :How to get custom fontname Attributes of Custom TextView for Set font to Textview.Based on Attributes value set Font in TextViewpublic class MyTextView extends TextView{    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyle)    {        super(context, attrs, defStyle);        init();    }    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)    {        super(context, attrs);        init();    }    public MyTextView(Context context)    {        super(context);        init();    }    public void init()    {          // set font_name based on attribute value of textview in xml file          String font_name = "";        if (!isInEditMode())        {            Typeface tf = Typeface.createFromAsset(getContext().getAssets(),                    "fonts/"+font_name);            setTypeface(tf);        }    }In Xml File<com.Example.MyTextView             android:id="@+id/header"            android:layout_width="wrap_content"            android:layout_height="wrap_content"            fontname="font.ttf"            android:text="Header"   />I also Put font.ttf file in assets->fontsThank You
Please using this api: TypedArray.getString.
Answer: $CODE:
```java
public class MyTextView extends TextView {
    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyle) {
        super(context, attrs, defStyle);
        init(attrs);
    }

    public MyTextView(Context context, AttributeSet attrs) {
        super(context, attrs);
        init(attrs);
    }

    public MyTextView(Context context) {
        super(context);
        init(null);
    }

    public void init(AttributeSet attrs) {
        if (attrs != null) {
            TypedArray a = getContext().obtainStyledAttributes(attrs, R.styleable.MyTextView);
            String font_name = a.getString(R.styleable.MyTextView_fontname);
            a.recycle();

            if (font_name != null && !isInEditMode()) {
                Typeface tf = Typeface.createFromAsset(getContext().getAssets(), "fonts/" + font_name);
                setTypeface(tf);
            }
        }
    }
}
```
$EXPLANATION:
In the init method, we are getting the attribute values from the AttributeSet. We are using the TypedArray to get the value of the fontname attribute. The R.styleable.MyTextView_fontname is the id of the fontname attribute in the MyTextView styleable. The getString method is used to get the value of the fontname attribute. The TypedArray is recycled after it is no longer needed. If the font_name is not null and the TextView is not in edit mode, we set the typeface of the TextView to the font specified by the font_name.

Please note that the font file should be placed in the assets/fonts directory of your project.

Also, don't forget to declare the fontname attribute in your custom TextView in the attrs.xml file:

```xml
<declare-styleable name="MyTextView">
    <attr name="fontname" format="string" />
</declare-styleable>
```

This will allow you to use the fontname attribute in your XML files.
